1.question: Why is AWS more economical than traditional data centers for applications with varying compute workloads?

options.A: Amazon EC2 Costs are billed on a monthly basis.
options.B: Customers retain full administrative access to their Amazon EC2 instances.
options.C: Customers can permanently run enough instances to handle peak workloads.
options.D: Amazon EC2 instances can be launched on-demand when needed.

2.question: If your project requires monthly reports that iterate through very large amounts of data, which Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud EC2 purchasing option should you consider?

3.question: What is included in an Amazon Machine Image (AMI)?

options.A: A template for the root volume for the instance.
options.B: Launch permissions that control which AWS accounts can use the AMI to launch instances.
options.C: A block device mapping that specifies the volumes to attach to the instance when it's launched.

4.question: Which Amazon Elastic Compute Cloud EC2 feature ensures your instances will not share a physical host with instances from any other AWS customer?

5.question: Which of the following services is a serverless compute service in AWS?

6.question: What is the service provided by AWS that enables developers to easily deploy and manage applications in the cloud?

7.question: Your web application needs four instances to support steady traffic all of the time. On the last day of the month, the traffic triples. What is the most cost-effective way to handle this pattern?

options.A: Run 12 reserved instances all of the time.
options.B: Run four On-demand Instances constantly, then add eight more On-Demand on the last day of each month.
options.C: Run four Reserved Instances constantly, then add eight On-Demand Instances on the last day of each month.
options.D: Run four On-Demand Instances constantly, then add eight Reserved Instances on the last day of each month.

8.question: Containers contain an entire operating system.

9.question: Which Amazon EC2 option is best for long-term workload with predictable usage patterns?
